B

Bluetooth - Class in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The Bluetooth class facilitates communication between an Android device and a Bluetooth accessory.
Bluetooth(Bluetooth.Delegate, Activity, boolean) - Constructor for class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth
Instantiate a Bluetooth object for communication between an Android device and a Bluetooth accessory.
Bluetooth.Delegate - Interface in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The Bluetooth.Delegate interface defines methods that will be called from a Bluetooth instance to inform an interested object (typically the entity that creates the Bluetooth class) of changes to the Bluetooth instance's state.
bluetoothAdapterChangedState(Bluetooth, int, int) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth.Delegate
A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothAdapterChangedState() to notify its delegate that a BluetoothAdapter.ACTION_STATE_CHANGED message has been received.
bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged(Bluetooth, BluetoothDevice, int, int) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth.Delegate
A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged() when a BluetoothDevice.ACTION_BOND_STATE_CHANGED message is received.
bluetoothDeviceConnected(Bluetooth, BluetoothDevice, BluetoothSocket) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth.Delegate
A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceConnected() when a BluetoothDevice is physically connected.
bluetoothDeviceDisconnected(Bluetooth, BluetoothDevice, boolean) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth.Delegate
A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceDisconnected() when a BluetoothDevice is physically disconnected.
bluetoothDeviceDiscovered(Bluetooth, BluetoothDevice) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth.Delegate
A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceDiscovered() when the Bluetooth instance has been put into discovery mode and a new Bluetooth device is discovered.
BluetoothSocketWrapper - Class in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The BluetoothSocketWrapper class converts an Android BluetoothSocket instance into a LightX-compatible Socket instance.
BluetoothSocketWrapper(BluetoothSocket) - Constructor for class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.BluetoothSocketWrapper
 
bondStateDescription(int) - Static method in class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth
Returns a string describing the passed bondState.

L

LightX - Class in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The LightX class implements Avnera's LightX Protocol and is used to facilitate communication between an Android device and hardware utilizing Avnera's LightX chip.
LightX(ModuleId, LightX.Delegate, Socket) - Constructor for class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX
Instantiate a LightX object.
LightX.Delegate - Interface in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The LightX.Delegate interface defines methods that will be called from a LightX instance to inform an interested object (typically the entity that creates the LightX class) of changes to the LightX instance's state.
LightX.FirmwareRegion - Enum in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
For firmware read and write calls, a FirmwareRegion defines the region to access.
LightX.FirmwareWriteOperation - Enum in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
During the firmware write operation, the LightX delegate will be called back via the lightXFirmwareUpdateProgress() callback and passed a FirmwareWriteOperation to indicate the current firmware write operation.
lightXAppReadResult(LightX, Command, boolean, byte[]) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
A LightX instance calls lightXAppReadResult() to return the result of read command initiated by calling readApp()
lightXAppReceivedPush(LightX, Command, byte[]) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
A LightX instance calls lightXAppReceivedPush() when a "push" packet is received from the application firmware.
lightXAppWriteResult(LightX, Command, boolean) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
A LightX instance calls lightXAppWriteResult() to return the result of a write command initiated by calling one of the writeApp*() methods.
lightXError(LightX, Exception) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
A LightX instance calls lightXError() when an error occurs during command processing.
lightXFirmwareReadStatus(LightX, LightX.FirmwareRegion, int, byte[]) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
lightXFirmwareReadStatus() delivers data initiated by a call to readFirmware().
lightXFirmwareWriteStatus(LightX, LightX.FirmwareRegion, LightX.FirmwareWriteOperation, double, Exception) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
During a firmware write operation, the LightX delegate is called back with progress updates of each operation (see the documentation for LightX.FirmwareWriteOperation).
lightXIsInBootloader(LightX, boolean) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
A LightX instance calls lightXIsInBootloader() to indicate whether the device is executing bootloader code.
lightXReadConfigResult(LightX, Command, boolean, String) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
A LightX instance calls lightXAppReadResult() to return the result of a read command initiated by calling one of the readConfig* or readApp* methods.
lightXWillRetransmit(LightX, Command) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX.Delegate
lightXWillRetransmit() notifies the delegate that the LightX command-write thread is going to retransmit a command to the LightX hardware (occurs when no response is received after sending a command and a timeout expires) and gives the delegate the opportunity to abort the retransmit operation.
Log - Class in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The Log class provides logging semantics similar to Android's android.util.Log class.
log(Log.Level, String, String) - Method in interface com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Log.Delegate
log() is called each time the SmartDigitalHeadset library writes a message to the log.
Log.Delegate - Interface in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The class implementing the Log.Delegate protocol and registering itself via the sLogDelegate member will receive messages logged by the SmartDigitalHeadset library.
Log.Level - Enum in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
Various level constants describing the Log message severity.

putBoolean(boolean, byte[], int) - Static method in class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Utility
putBoolean() is a utility method that converts a boolean value into a four-byte little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..
putFloat(float, byte[], int) - Static method in class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Utility
putFloat() is a utility method that converts a float value (32-bits on Java platforms) into a four-byte little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..
putInt(int, byte[], int) - Static method in class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Utility
putInt() is a utility method that converts a the low 32-bits of the long 'value' argument into little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..
putUnsignedInt(long, byte[], int) - Static method in class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Utility
PutUnsignedInt() is a utility method that converts the low 32-bits of the long 'value' argument into little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..

S

sEnablePacketDumps - Static variable in class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX
When true, sEnablePacketDumps will cause packet data contents to be written to the debug log in hexadecimal format.
sLogDelegate - Static variable in class com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Log

Socket - Interface in com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset
The Socket interface is consumed by the LightX class and is intended to be used as an abstraction layer for classes that provide (or can be made to provide) socket-like semantics.
